Sale Contract for Barge, Rail and Trucks

Contract No.: TRAMMO-MM-2026-0007
Date: January 20, 2026

BETWEEN:
Trammo, Inc. â€” Ammonia Division ("Seller")
AND:
CF Industries Holdings, Inc. ("Buyer")

TRAMMO GENERAL TERMS AND CONDITIONS (SALES)

1. PRODUCT AND SPECIFICATIONS

Product: Anhydrous Ammonia
Specifications: Minimum purity 99.5%, water content maximum 0.3%,
oil content maximum 5 ppm.

2. INCOTERMS

INCOTERMS 2020: FOB Seller's barge loading terminal, Donaldsonville, Louisiana,
or CPT Buyer's designated rail terminal, per individual shipment basis.

3. PRICE

Price: US $405.00 per metric ton for barge deliveries. Rail deliveries at
$415.00 per metric ton. All prices are fixed price per shipment.

4. PAYMENT

Payment: By telegraphic transfer within 30 days from bill of lading date for
barge shipments, or 30 days from delivery date for rail/truck deliveries.

5. INSPECTION AND QUANTITY DETERMINATION

Inspection: An independent inspector appointed by Seller at loading point.
Bill of lading quantity shall be final and binding for barge shipments.
Certified scale weight at delivery point for truck shipments. Flow meter
readings for rail car deliveries.

6. LAYTIME AND DEMURRAGE

Laytime: Barge laytime shall be 36 running hours from time of NOR.
Demurrage: $8,000 per day or pro rata for barge demurrage. Rail car
detention charges per railroad tariff. Truck free hours: 2 hours from
arrival, then $100 per hour.

7. FORCE MAJEURE

Force Majeure: Neither party shall be liable for delays caused by Force
Majeure events including but not limited to: floods, hurricanes, lock
closures, rail embargoes, government orders, labor disputes, or equipment
failure beyond reasonable control. Notice within 3 days.

8. DEFAULT AND REMEDIES

Event of Default: Material default not remedied within 48 hours of notice
entitles termination. Interest at 2% per annum on late payments. Mutual
right of setoff and netting is preserved.

9. DISCLAIMER OF WARRANTIES

Disclaimer of Warranties: SELLER MAKES NO WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS
OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY.

10. CLAIMS

Claims: Written notice of claim within 30 days of delivery. Claims shall
be absolutely barred unless action is commenced within one year from date
of delivery.

11. GOVERNING LAW AND ARBITRATION

Governing Law: Laws of the State of New York shall govern this contract.
Arbitration: Disputes shall be settled by arbitration under SMA rules
in New York.

12. NOTICES

Notices: Notices deemed to be given when sent by courier, fax, or e-mail.

13. MISCELLANEOUS

Miscellaneous: Entire Agreement of the parties. Modifications in writing
only. No Waiver of breach implies waiver of future breach. Assignment
requires consent. Severability applies.
